name: Overview
main:
22.2 million people are in need of humanitarian aid, including 11.3 million people in acute need. Fighting escalated in March 2015, and an armed advance on the capital in September 2014 by Houthis from the north triggered a civil war throughout the country. ??? A coalition of Arab states led by Saudi Arabia is supporting the Yemeni government with airstrikes. Activities by southern secessionists, Al Qaeda in the Arabian Peninsula (AQAP) and Islamic State (IS) compound the security and political challenges.? The economy is also failing, with the Central Bank near collapse. ?

The Inter-Agency Standing Committee (IASC) declared Yemen a Level 3 emergency in July 2015. INFORM measures Yemen's risk of humanitarian crisis and disaster at a very high level of 7.6/10. Hazard and exposure as well as lack of coping capacity and vulnerability are all at alarming levels: 8.1/10, 7.9/10 and 6.9/10 respectively.?
latest_developments_past: 15/12: More than 1,400 people have fled from Taizz and Al Hudaydah to the Ash Shamateen district in southern Taizz, and Al Fayoosh district in Lahj following increased fighting in Al Hudaydah and Taizz governorates. Actual displacement numbers are expected to be higher.?
